text: the discussion of truly elite American
tennis players begins with andy roddick
Roddick is ranked fifth overall in the
world the only American in the top ten
in fact this is the first US open since
rankings began in 1973 where there was
only one American ranked in the top 20
after erotic there are a few players you
have a guy like James Blake who's ranked
21st in the world but it struggled
through injuries this season you have
guys like Sam Querrey and John Isner a
doubles team that will compete on court
n over there later today but are also
rising singles players you know on the
rise but not necessarily at the point
where they can win major championships
below them you have a host of younger
players who have not yet developed guys
like Devin Britain who was a sacrificial
land to Roger Federer in the first round
or guys like chase Buchanan who lost
yesterday to jo-wilfried tsonga John
Isner plays later today in the second
round man match it's actually an
intriguing matchup he plays Marcel ilhan
from turkey who's the first Turkish
player to compete in the grand slam he
also is the first Turkish player
obviously to win a Grand Slam match Sam
Querrey plays kevin kim and Blake is
also in the second round as well Patrick
McEnroe has taken over the play a player
development program for the United
States Tennis Association I talked to
McEnroe yesterday and he's only been
doing it for about a year and a half
when I talked to Mack and roll what he
said is that the real development for
the usta is going to come from players
who are now nine ten eleven years old
and when they reach this level because
of the new training facility training
procedures they have in place they'll be
better off so you could be looking at
nine ten years down the road before you
see a real group of Americans here the
US Open competing against each other for
the championship
